Test: coverage

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-03-21

Source: vignettes/tests/test.Rmd
test.Rmd

See tests in semmcci_notes 

library(testthat)
library(semmcci)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'semmcci'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     print
library(lavaan)
#> This is lavaan 0.6-8
#> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.

With Defined Parameters

# Generate Data ------------------------------------------------------------
n <- 1000
x <- rnorm(n = n)
m <- 0.50 * x + rnorm(n = n)
y <- 0.25 * x + 0.50 * m + rnorm(n = n)
data <- data.frame(x, m, y)

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
  ab := a * b
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model,
  fixed.x = FALSE
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2543 0.0351 100  0.1878 0.1912 0.1983  0.3354  0.3435   0.3440
#> b    0.5653 0.0320 100  0.4798 0.4848 0.4956  0.6137  0.6240   0.6313
#> a    0.4791 0.0290 100  0.4210 0.4217 0.4275  0.5323  0.5490   0.5522
#> y~~y 0.9863 0.0417 100  0.9017 0.9031 0.9078  1.0624  1.0704   1.0717
#> m~~m 1.0647 0.0445 100  0.9625 0.9710 0.9846  1.1498  1.1856   1.2115
#> x~~x 1.0365 0.0448 100  0.9205 0.9278 0.9554  1.1104  1.1460   1.1691
#> ab   0.2708 0.0211 100  0.2202 0.2236 0.2333  0.3145  0.3218   0.3240

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2039 0.0281 100  0.1506 0.1533 0.1590  0.2689  0.2754   0.2758
#> b    0.5081 0.0288 100  0.4313 0.4358 0.4455  0.5516  0.5609   0.5674
#> a    0.4274 0.0259 100  0.3755 0.3762 0.3813  0.4748  0.4897   0.4926
#> y~~y 0.6117 0.0259 100  0.5593 0.5601 0.5630  0.6589  0.6639   0.6647
#> m~~m 0.8173 0.0342 100  0.7389 0.7454 0.7558  0.8827  0.9101   0.9301
#> x~~x 1.0000 0.0433 100  0.8881 0.8952 0.9218  1.0713  1.1057   1.1280
#> ab   0.2172 0.0169 100  0.1766 0.1793 0.1870  0.2521  0.2580   0.2598

Without Defined Parameters

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2543 0.0389 100  0.1640 0.1715 0.1863  0.3257  0.3522   0.3658
#> b    0.5653 0.0297 100  0.4972 0.4978 0.5139  0.6339  0.6528   0.6541
#> a    0.4791 0.0297 100  0.4102 0.4141 0.4219  0.5347  0.5452   0.5453
#> y~~y 0.9863 0.0408 100  0.8722 0.8892 0.9144  1.0553  1.1036   1.1044
#> m~~m 1.0647 0.0452 100  0.9593 0.9616 0.9779  1.1466  1.1533   1.1579
#> x~~x 1.0365     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2039 0.0312 100  0.1315 0.1375 0.1494  0.2611  0.2824   0.2933
#> b    0.5081 0.0267 100  0.4469 0.4474 0.4619  0.5698  0.5868   0.5879
#> a    0.4274 0.0265 100  0.3659 0.3694 0.3763  0.4769  0.4863   0.4864
#> y~~y 0.6117 0.0253 100  0.5409 0.5515 0.5671  0.6545  0.6845   0.6850
#> m~~m 0.8173 0.0347 100  0.7365 0.7382 0.7507  0.8802  0.8854   0.8889
#> x~~x 1.0000     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA
test_that("TRUE", {
  expect_true(
    TRUE
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽŠ
